abstract: A spate of multibillion-dollar mergers and acquisitions surprised investors, who had expected deal activity to slow in a grim economic environment.
snippet: A spate of multibillion-dollar mergers and acquisitions surprised investors, who had expected deal activity to slow in a grim economic environment.
lead_paragraph: Turmoil in the stock market. A downgrade of the United States credit rating. The economic crisis in Europe.

headline.main: Casting Off Gloom, Deal Makers Are in a Frenzy of Activity

abstract: Europe’s sovereign debt crisis threatened to spill over into the broader economy as figures showed that growth in the euro zone fell to its lowest rate in two years.
snippet: Europe’s sovereign debt crisis threatened to spill over into the broader economy as figures showed that growth in the euro zone fell to its lowest rate in two years.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Europe’s sovereign debt crisis threatened to spill over into the broader economy after official figures released Tuesday showed that growth in the euro zone fell to its lowest rate in two years. Germany — the Continent’s powerhouse — slowed almost to a standstill.

headline.main: Europe’s Debt Crisis Weakens Quarterly Growth
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Debt Crisis Weakens Quarterly Growth

abstract: A sale of the Merrill Lynch real estate holdings would be the latest move by Bank of America to shed noncore assets and raise additional capital.
snippet: A sale of the Merrill Lynch real estate holdings would be the latest move by Bank of America to shed noncore assets and raise additional capital.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America is in talks to sell a major portion of Merrill Lynch‘s real estate portfolio to the Blackstone Group for up to $1 billion, a person briefed on the matter told DealBook on Tuesday, as the bank seeks to raise additional capital.

headline.main: Bank of America in Talks With Blackstone Over Merrill Real Estate

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Ben Protess
